metadata.description: Catalog of official Google Cloud documentation referenced by this MCP server. Each entry maps a supported service to the public docs that operators rely on most so teams can quickly answer questions or deep-link the MCP responses.

docTypes.overview: High-level product introductions and landing pages.
docTypes.quickstart: Step-by-step tasks to enable APIs and run first workloads.
docTypes.concept: Conceptual explanations of data models, architecture, and behavior.
docTypes.guide: Procedural guides for accomplishing a scenario end-to-end.
docTypes.how-to: Focused instructions for a single configuration or operation.
docTypes.reference: Non-API reference material such as SQL or configuration syntax.
docTypes.cli-reference: Command-line references for gcloud or other CLIs.
docTypes.sdk: Client library usage guides and supported languages.
docTypes.best-practice: Operational or design recommendations validated by Google.
docTypes.iam: Access control, IAM roles, and permissions guidance.
docTypes.security: Encryption, compliance, and data handling specifics.
docTypes.pricing: Billing, pricing, and cost optimization references.
docTypes.integration: Docs covering integrations with other Google Cloud services.
docTypes.migration: Guidance for migrating or modernizing workloads.
docTypes.operations: Incident response, SLOs, runbooks, and day-2 operations.

services.summary: Centralized, schema-aware log ingestion with analytics, routing, exports, alerting, and IAM-aware controls for every Google Cloud workload.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: Explains Cloud Logging architecture, ingestion pipeline options, regional availability, and how it connects to the rest of Google Cloud Observability.

documents.title: Quickstart: Console
documents.description: Enables the API, creates a sample log entry, and walks through the Logs Explorer inside the Google Cloud console.

documents.title: Quickstart: gcloud CLI
documents.description: Covers prerequisites, IAM roles, and `gcloud logging` commands required to write and read log entries from the terminal.

documents.title: Log Explorer and Logging Query Language
documents.description: Documents filter expressions, functions, histogram visualizations, and saved query workflows for the Logs Explorer UI.

documents.title: Log Analytics workspace
documents.description: Explains BigQuery-backed log views, SQL workspace usage, and how to manage analytics-enabled log buckets.

documents.title: Log buckets and retention planning
documents.description: Describes default, user-defined, and analytics buckets along with retention policies, locations, and lifecycle automation.

documents.title: Log Router and sinks
documents.description: Covers inclusion filters, exclusions, and sink destinations for routing logs to BigQuery, Pub/Sub, and Cloud Storage.

documents.title: Log exports
documents.description: Step-by-step instructions for exporting logs, wiring destinations, testing throughput, and validating delivery guarantees.

documents.title: Log-based metrics
documents.description: Details counter and distribution metrics, aggregation windows, and how they surface to Cloud Monitoring alert policies.

documents.title: Configure notifications and alerts
documents.description: Explains notification channels, alert frequency, and best practices for routing log-based incidents.

documents.title: Ops Agent and Logging agents
documents.description: Lists installation flows, file tailing, structured logging, and legacy agent migration guidance.

documents.title: Access control (IAM)
documents.description: Documents predefined roles, custom role scopes, and least-privilege planning for logging admins and viewers.

documents.title: Customer-managed encryption keys
documents.description: Explains CMEK-eligible resources, key rotation, and failure handling for encrypted log storage.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Enumerates ingestion throughput, bucket, sink, and API quotas along with request limit increase steps.

documents.title: Pricing and retention tiers
documents.description: Breaks down free allotments, storage classes, analytics surcharges, and committed use considerations.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Full REST surface for entries, sinks, metrics, buckets, exclusions, and operations.

documents.title: gcloud logging commands
documents.description: Command descriptions, flags, and examples for log entries, sinks, buckets, and exclusions.

documents.title: Client libraries
documents.description: Lists supported languages, auth setup, batching, and region routing guidance for logging SDKs.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Chronological release log covering API additions, region launches, and behavior changes.

documents.title: Code samples catalog
documents.description: Ready-to-run snippets for common ingestion, filtering, sink routing, and analytics workflows.

services.summary: Unified metric ingestion, dashboards, SLOs, and incident response across hybrid workloads powered by Google Cloud's operations suite.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: Landing page outlining core Monitoring capabilities, agents, integrations, and console navigation.

documents.title: Quickstart: Console
documents.description: Guides administrators through enabling the API, selecting a metrics scope, and viewing dashboards inside the console.

documents.title: Quickstart: gcloud CLI
documents.description: Shows how to configure Monitoring resources and view time series entirely with `gcloud monitoring` commands.

documents.title: Metrics, resources, and time series
documents.description: Describes metric kinds, value types, MonitoredResource mappings, and aggregation windows.

documents.title: Custom metrics guide
documents.description: Explains how to create user-defined metrics via API, agents, or OpenTelemetry collectors.

documents.title: Monitoring Query Language (MQL)
documents.description: Documents the functional query language for building advanced charts and SLO alert conditions.

documents.title: Dashboards and charts
documents.description: Shows how to design custom dashboards, share them, and embed dynamic filters.

documents.title: Alerting policies
documents.description: Covers notification channels, documentation templates, muting rules, and multi-condition policies.

documents.title: Notification channel options
documents.description: Catalogs supported channels (email, SMS, PagerDuty, Webhooks) and how to verify them.

documents.title: Uptime checks
documents.description: Explains probe regions, managed SSL verification, content matching, and alert hookup.

documents.title: Service Level Objectives
documents.description: Defines SLO concepts, error budgets, burn-rate alerting, and service hierarchies.

documents.title: Incident management
documents.description: Shows how incidents are created from alerts, triaged, acknowledged, and resolved.

documents.title: Managed Service for Prometheus
documents.description: Explains ingestion pipelines, scraping options, and compatibility with open-source Prometheus tooling.

documents.title: Cloud Monitoring agents
documents.description: Installation, upgrade, and configuration flows for the legacy monitoring agent and Ops Agent.

documents.title: Access control and scoping
documents.description: Lists Monitoring-specific IAM roles, metrics scopes, and organization-wide restrictions.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Describes default write/read quotas, time-series caps, and throughput request workflows.

documents.title: Pricing
documents.description: Breaks down free tier, data retention charges, and billing metrics per million samples.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Lists REST endpoints for time series, alert policies, SLOs, channels, and dashboards.

documents.title: gcloud monitoring commands
documents.description: Reference for `gcloud monitoring` subcommands covering metrics scopes, alert policies, and channels.

documents.title: Client libraries
documents.description: Shows language support, auto-instrumentation options, and code samples for reading/writing metrics.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Historical log of Monitoring feature launches, region updates, and deprecations.

services.summary: Distributed tracing with automatic instrumentation, OpenTelemetry support, latency analytics, and export pipelines for Google Cloud workloads.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: High-level summary of Trace use cases, instrumentation models, and UI surfaces.

documents.title: Quickstart
documents.description: Enables the Trace API, configures IAM, and guides you through collecting the first spans.

documents.title: Instrumentation: Java
documents.description: Shows agent installation, exporters, and sampling strategies for Java applications.

documents.title: Instrumentation: Go
documents.description: Explains Go agent setup, context propagation, and how to capture HTTP and gRPC spans.

documents.title: Instrumentation: Node.js
documents.description: Details npm packages, automatic framework hooks, and manual span creation for Node.js apps.

documents.title: Instrumentation: Python
documents.description: Walks through pip packages, exporter configuration, and instrumentation helpers for Python.

documents.title: Instrumentation: .NET
documents.description: Describes NuGet packages, ASP.NET auto-instrumentation, and manual spans.

documents.title: Instrumentation: Ruby
documents.description: Outlines gem configuration, Rack middleware hooks, and manual span reporting.

documents.title: Analyze traces
documents.description: Explains latency heatmaps, percentile charts, trace filtering, and span drill-downs.

documents.title: Export traces to BigQuery
documents.description: Configures sink connections so traces can be queried in BigQuery or visualized in Looker.

documents.title: Troubleshooting and sampling
documents.description: Covers missing spans, latency buckets, sampling rates, and validation tips.

documents.title: Access control
documents.description: Lists roles for viewing, exporting, and administering Trace data.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Details ingestion rate, API usage caps, and span retention policies.

documents.title: Pricing
documents.description: Explains free tier sampling allotments and billed span volume.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Full REST surface for batch writing spans and reading trace data.

documents.title: gcloud trace commands
documents.description: Command reference for exporting, describing, and deleting traces via CLI.

documents.title: Client libraries
documents.description: Language guides, dependency coordinates, and authentication examples.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Timeline of Trace API, UI, and instrumentation feature changes.

documents.title: Best practices
documents.description: Guidance on span naming, sampling defaults, and cost-efficient trace collection.

services.summary: Always-on statistical profiling for CPU and heap usage across Google Cloud compute platforms with minimal overhead.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: Outlines supported runtimes, sampling methodology, and visualization surfaces.

documents.title: Quickstart: Go
documents.description: Installs the Go agent, configures service name/version labels, and validates profile uploads.

documents.title: Quickstart: Java
documents.description: Shows how to install the Java agent, set system properties, and capture CPU/memory profiles.

documents.title: Quickstart: Python
documents.description: Covers pip packages, sampling configuration, and Cloud Run deployment tips for Python.

documents.title: Quickstart: Node.js
documents.description: Explains npm modules, auto-instrumentation, and CPU/heap profiling for Node.js apps.

documents.title: Profile Compute Engine workloads
documents.description: Describes metadata-based configuration, startup scripts, and scaling guidance on VM instances.

documents.title: Profile GKE workloads
documents.description: Shows how to run the Profiler agent as a sidecar or daemonset in Kubernetes.

documents.title: Profile Cloud Run services
documents.description: Lists Cloud Run-specific environment variables, buildpacks, and container flags.

documents.title: Profiling concepts
documents.description: Defines sample rates, profile types, symbolization, and retention model.

documents.title: Use the Profiler UI
documents.description: Walks through flame graphs, comparison mode, and sharing insights with teammates.

documents.title: Best practices
documents.description: Covers label hygiene, sampling cadence, and safety guidelines for production profiling.

documents.title: Configure profiles
documents.description: Documents environment variables, overrides, and advanced configuration options.

documents.title: Access control
documents.description: Lists viewer, agent, and admin roles along with minimum IAM permissions.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Details sampling caps, concurrent profile limits, and how to request increases.

documents.title: Pricing
documents.description: Describes free tiers and incremental charges for additional profiling hours.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Docs for profile creation, symbolization, and listing REST endpoints.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Tracks agent version releases, UI improvements, and region availability.

services.summary: Aggregated crash analytics, alerting, and triage for exceptions emitted by Google Cloud and hybrid workloads.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: Introduces Error Reporting concepts, ingestion paths, and supported runtimes.

documents.title: Quickstart
documents.description: Walks through enabling the API, creating IAM bindings, and triggering a sample exception.

documents.title: Setup on Compute Engine
documents.description: Covers agent installation, service account scoping, and troubleshooting on VM instances.

documents.title: Setup on GKE
documents.description: Explains sidecar configuration, workload identity, and pod-level exception capture.

documents.title: Setup on Cloud Run
documents.description: Details environment variables, structured logging, and recommended base images for Cloud Run.

documents.title: Setup on Cloud Functions
documents.description: Shows default logging-based ingestion and how to report custom exceptions from functions.

documents.title: Setup on App Engine
documents.description: Documents automatic instrumentations and custom logging for App Engine standard and flexible.

documents.title: Setup: Java
documents.description: Explains Maven/Gradle dependencies, exception handlers, and asynchronous reporting for Java.

documents.title: Setup: Node.js
documents.description: Shows npm module configuration, Express middleware, and manual reporting helpers.

documents.title: Setup: Python
documents.description: Covers pip modules, Django/Flask integration, and synchronous vs async reporting.

documents.title: View and triage errors
documents.description: Explains groupings, fingerprints, stack traces, and linking to source code.

documents.title: Notifications and alerting
documents.description: Configures email, SMS, webhook, and Cloud Monitoring alert integrations.

documents.title: Access control
documents.description: Details viewer, reporter, and admin roles and the APIs they unlock.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Reference for events, projects, and delete operations in the Error Reporting API.

documents.title: Client libraries
documents.description: Language support table, initialization examples, and transport details.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Lists default event ingestion quotas, rate limits, and retention policies.

documents.title: Pricing
documents.description: Explains free tiers, included exceptions, and overage billing.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Chronicles Error Reporting launches, behavior changes, and SDK updates.

documents.title: Data retention and privacy
documents.description: Documents data handling timelines, personally identifiable information controls, and export recommendations.

services.summary: Horizontally scalable, strongly consistent relational database with SQL support, online schema changes, and multi-region availability.

documents.title: Product overview
documents.description: Explains core Spanner concepts, regional options, and primary use cases.

documents.title: Quickstart: Console
documents.description: Creates an instance, database, table, and sample data entirely via the console.

documents.title: Quickstart: Command line
documents.description: Shows how to initialize Spanner resources with gcloud CLI and execute queries.

documents.title: Architecture and internals
documents.description: Describes TrueTime, sharding, replication, and failover characteristics.

documents.title: Schema design
documents.description: Guidance for interleaving, key choice, secondary indexes, and data types.

documents.title: Transactions
documents.description: Explains read-write vs read-only transactions, locking, and retry handling.

documents.title: Standard SQL reference
documents.description: Outlines SQL syntax, functions, data types, and dialect differences for Spanner.

documents.title: Change streams
documents.description: Covers enabling change streams, consuming data, and integrating with Dataflow.

documents.title: Backup and restore
documents.description: Explains backup schedules, encryption, and restore workflows.

documents.title: Point-in-time recovery
documents.description: Shows how to enable PITR, select recovery timestamps, and manage storage.

documents.title: Instances and configurations
documents.description: Details node sizing, regional vs multi-regional configs, and processing units.

documents.title: Autoscaler
documents.description: Instructions for enabling the Spanner autoscaler, policies, and monitoring behavior.

documents.title: Spanner emulator
documents.description: Installs the emulator locally or via Docker and configures client libraries to target it.

documents.title: Migration guide
documents.description: Assesses workloads, uses HarbourBridge/Dataflow, and tracks cutover steps.

documents.title: Client libraries
documents.description: Lists language support, session pooling tips, and retry helpers.

documents.title: REST API reference
documents.description: Full REST API surface for admin, data, and operations methods.

documents.title: gcloud spanner commands
documents.description: Reference for provisioning instances, backups, and executing SQL via CLI.

documents.title: IAM roles and permissions
documents.description: Enumerates database, instance, and backup roles plus least-privilege guidance.

documents.title: Customer-managed encryption keys
documents.description: Details CMEK-eligible resources, failover planning, and audit logging.

documents.title: Quotas and limits
documents.description: Lists per-project resource caps, API quotas, and request increase process.

documents.title: Pricing
documents.description: Breaks down compute, storage, backup, and change stream pricing dimensions.

documents.title: Release notes
documents.description: Change log for API, SQL, region, and feature launches.

documents.title: Code samples
documents.description: Multi-language samples for DDL, DML, batch reads, and partitioned queries.

documents.title: Performance best practices
documents.description: Recommendations for hotspot avoidance, request sizing, and query tuning.

services.summary: Google Cloud Support plans, case management, APIs, and operational practices that keep critical workloads healthy.

documents.title: Cloud Customer Care overview
documents.description: Explains support mission, customer responsibilities, and links to plan comparisons.

documents.title: Getting support on Google Cloud
documents.description: Walks new administrators through activating support, verifying billing, and accessing community resources.

documents.title: Customer Care portfolio
documents.description: Summarizes Standard, Enhanced, Premium, and value-add services plus SLAs.

documents.title: Standard Support
documents.description: Outlines eligibility, response targets, and scope of the Standard plan.

documents.title: Enhanced Support
documents.description: Details designated contacts, business support hours, and TAM-lite benefits.

documents.title: Premium Support
documents.description: Covers technical account management, SRE assistance, and mission critical workflows.

documents.title: Create and manage support cases
documents.description: Documents case lifecycle, severities, troubleshooting expectations, and user access requirements.

documents.title: Language support and working hours
documents.description: Lists supported languages, business hours, and chat availability for each plan.

documents.title: Planned event support
documents.description: Explains how to request launch assistance, risk reviews, and success criteria for major events.

documents.title: Third-party technology support
documents.description: Defines what Google covers for partner solutions and how to coordinate multivendor cases.

documents.title: Privacy best practices
documents.description: Guides teams on redacting data, encrypting attachments, and sharing only necessary logs.

documents.title: Access control and case sharing
documents.description: Explains support-specific IAM roles, user management, and auditability.

documents.title: Resources for Customer Care
documents.description: Lists curated runbooks, communities, and status dashboards recommended by Google.

documents.title: Cloud Support API reference
documents.description: REST documentation for listing cases, attachments, comments, and time entries.
